Implement editor extension flagging, trailing paragraph behavior, slash command badges, and page description support across Space and shared packages:

1) Add CE flagging hook for editors
- File: apps/space/ce/hooks/use-editor-flagging.ts
- Create a React utility that exports useEditorFlagging(anchor: string) returning an object with three keys: document, liteText, and richText. Each key contains: { disabled: TExtensions[]; flagged: TExtensions[] }.
- Type disabled and flagged arrays with TExtensions from @plane/editor. For now, return empty arrays for all categories (no flags/disabled by default). Keep the anchor argument for future conditional logic.

2) Wire flagging into Space editors and update props
- File: apps/space/core/components/editor/lite-text-editor.tsx
  - Import the hook using the existing app alias for CE (e.g., "@/plane-web/hooks/use-editor-flagging").
  - Change the component to no longer accept a flaggedExtensions prop. Keep disabledExtensions but treat incoming values as additionalDisabledExtensions (default empty array).
  - Call useEditorFlagging(anchor) and destructure liteText. Pass disabledExtensions as a merged array: [...liteText.disabled, ...additionalDisabledExtensions]. Pass flaggedExtensions from liteText.flagged. Keep other existing handlers and behavior unchanged.

- File: apps/space/core/components/editor/rich-text-editor.tsx
  - Import the hook (using the CE alias already used by the file).
  - Stop accepting a flaggedExtensions prop. Rename incoming disabledExtensions to additionalDisabledExtensions with default [] to merge with values from the hook.
  - Call useEditorFlagging(anchor) and use richText to pass disabledExtensions as [...richText.disabled, ...additionalDisabledExtensions] and flaggedExtensions as richText.flagged. Preserve mention and file handlers.

3) Fix trailing paragraph insertion logic in the editor container
- File: packages/editor/src/core/components/editors/editor-container.tsx
  - In the click handler where a trailing node is conditionally inserted, change the logic to:
    - Use editor.state.doc.lastChild to get the last child node of the document rather than resolving positions.
    - Determine if the last node is a paragraph by comparing to CORE_EXTENSIONS.PARAGRAPH, and ensure you do not treat the document node itself as eligible (compare to CORE_EXTENSIONS.DOCUMENT).
    - If last node exists and is not a paragraph and not the document node, insert a paragraph node at the end of the doc and focus end. Use endPosition = editor.state.doc.content.size for insertion.

4) Support optional badges in slash command items
- File: packages/editor/src/core/extensions/slash-commands/command-menu-item.tsx
  - Render an optional item.badge element after the title, if present.

- File: packages/editor/src/core/types/slash-commands-suggestion.ts
  - Import TEditorCommands as a type-only import.
  - Extend the CommandItem type to include an optional badge?: React.ReactNode property.

5) Add description object to page types and store
- File: packages/types/src/page/core.ts
  - Update TPage to include a description: object | undefined field.
  - Keep it compatible with TPageExtended by composing TPage with TPageExtended (intersection type), ensuring the description field appears in the primary TPage shape.

- File: apps/web/core/store/pages/base-page.ts
  - Add a description property on the BasePage class (type: object | undefined).
  - Initialize it from the incoming page object in the constructor.
  - Mark description as observable (non-ref) in makeObservable.
  - Include description in the asJSON getter so it serializes with the rest of the page fields.

Acceptance criteria:
- Space lite and rich editors derive disabled/flagged extensions exclusively from useEditorFlagging, merging only additional disabled items provided via props. flaggedExtensions is no longer accepted from props in these wrappers.
- Clicking the editor container inserts a final paragraph only when the documentâ€™s last child is not already a paragraph, using CORE_EXTENSIONS.DOCUMENT and CORE_EXTENSIONS.PARAGRAPH for checks.
- Slash command menu items can display an optional badge, and the type system allows it with type-only import hygiene.
- TPage includes a description field and BasePage tracks it as an observable and exposes it in asJSON.
- All imports resolve using existing path aliases in Space and packages.
evalCommits.prompt: Implement a community-edition hook to manage editor extension flagging and integrate it into the Space lite and rich text editors so they no longer accept flagged extensions via props and instead derive them from the hook. Adjust the editor container so clicking in the editor adds a trailing paragraph only when the last child of the document is not already a paragraph, comparing against the appropriate core extension constants. Enhance slash command items to support displaying an optional badge and update the related types accordingly. Finally, add a description object field to the shared Page type and update the Web BasePage store to track it as an observable and include it in serialized output.

Implement touch-device support and related editor enhancements across the editor package.

1) Props and Types
- Add isTouchDevice?: boolean, editorProps?: EditorProps, and onEditorFocus?: () => void to the editor props and flow:
  - Update IEditorProps and ICollaborativeDocumentEditorProps to include these. Ensure ICollaborativeDocumentEditorProps also supports documentLoaderClassName?: string and dragDropEnabled?: boolean, and allows extensions to be passed and merged rather than replaced.
  - Expand TEditorFontSize to include 'mobile-font' and TEditorLineSpacing to include 'mobile-regular'.
  - Extend TEditorCommands and TCommandWithProps to support a new 'link' command with payload { url: string; text?: string }.
  - Expand EditorRefApi to include: focus(args), undo(), redo(), getCoordsFromPos(pos?), getAttributesWithExtendedMark(mark, attribute), createSelectionAtCursorPosition(), and change scrollToNodeViaDOMCoordinates to accept an object parameter { pos?: number; behavior?: ScrollBehavior }.

2) Hooks and Extensions
- In use-editor and use-collaborative-editor hooks:
  - Accept and forward isTouchDevice, editorProps, onEditorFocus to the underlying editor setup.
  - Wire onFocus: onEditorFocus into the editor configuration.
  - Support dragDropEnabled as a prop in the collaborative path and pass it to the SideMenu extension instead of hard-coding true.
- In extensions.ts, pass isTouchDevice into UtilityExtension configuration.
- In UtilityExtension, add a boolean isTouchDevice field into its storage and initialize it from props.

3) Components
- Collaborative document editor (document/collaborative-editor.tsx):
  - Accept documentLoaderClassName, editorProps, isTouchDevice, dragDropEnabled, onEditorFocus.
  - Build the extensions list by merging external extensions (from props) with the optional issue embed extension using useMemo.
  - Pass new props (editorProps, isTouchDevice, dragDropEnabled, onEditorFocus) into the collaborative editor hook and renderer.
- Page renderer (document/page-renderer.tsx):
  - Accept documentLoaderClassName and isTouchDevice; pass isTouchDevice down to EditorContainer.
  - Forward className to DocumentContentLoader.
  - When editor.isEditable and on touch devices, hide hover/desktop-only controls (bubble menu and block menu) so they are not shown on touch devices.
- Editor container (editors/editor-container.tsx):
  - Accept isTouchDevice and, when true, do not render the link preview container. Continue click-to-focus behavior for empty container clicks.
- Editor wrapper (editors/editor-wrapper.tsx):
  - Accept and pass editorProps, isTouchDevice, and onEditorFocus to the editor hook and downstream components.

4) Menus and Commands
- Add a Link menu item to the editor menu (menus/menu-items.ts) with key 'link' that sets/unsets a link:
  - If a URL is provided, call setLinkEditor(editor, url, text?) to optionally insert/replace text and apply the link.
  - If no URL provided, call unsetLinkEditor(editor).
- Update editor-commands.ts:
  - Enhance setLinkEditor(editor, url, text?) so that if text is provided, it inserts/replaces the current selection with that text, selects it, and then applies the link mark.
  - Keep unsetLinkEditor behavior the same.

5) Image Extension UX for Touch Devices
- In custom image block/node view and toolbar components:
  - Read isTouchDevice from the UtilityExtension storage via getExtensionStorage and CORE_EXTENSIONS.UTILITY.
  - On image mousedown for touch devices, prevent default, blur the editor, and maintain the node selection behavior without triggering undesirable drag/selection.
  - When restoring the image source on touch devices, refresh the src via extension.options.getImageSource if available; otherwise, use the resolved image src.
  - In the image toolbar:
    - Pass isTouchDevice into the toolbar roots.
    - Hide download and open-in-new-tab actions on touch devices.
    - Make zoom buttons prevent default/stop propagation on touch before handling magnification.
  - In the uploader, do not automatically trigger the file input on insert events for touch devices.
  - In the node view, treat the node as uploaded if it has a src initially; update the upload state based on either resolvedSrc or existing node src.

6) Editor Ref Enhancements
- In editor-ref.ts:
  - Add methods: focus(args), undo(), redo(), createSelectionAtCursorPosition() that selects the current word at the caret when selection is empty, getCoordsFromPos(pos?), and getAttributesWithExtendedMark(mark, attribute) that first extends the mark range and returns attributes.
  - Update scrollToNodeViaDOMCoordinates to accept a single object parameter { pos?: number; behavior?: ScrollBehavior }.
  - Ensure ordering and presence of existing methods remains consistent and non-breaking except for the intentional signature change above.

7) CSS Variables for Mobile Typography and Spacing
- In styles/variables.css under .editor-container:
  - Add a .mobile-font configuration for font sizes and line heights across headings, regular text, code, and lists.
  - Add a .line-spacing-mobile-regular configuration mirroring the smaller spacing suitable for mobile.

8) Integration Details
- Ensure type-only imports are used where appropriate for Extensions and Editor types to keep bundles lean.
- Ensure all new props flow through getEditorClassNames and other class name builders so mobile font/spacing modes can be activated via class names.
- Ensure SideMenuExtension drag-and-drop behavior is toggled using the new dragDropEnabled prop to support touch scenarios.

Acceptance criteria:
- On touch devices, bubble menu, block menu tray, link preview overlays, and certain image toolbar actions are not shown or auto-triggered; zoom controls still work.
- Link menu item appears and supports inserting a link with optional replacement text; unsetting a link works.
- The editor ref exposes new focus, undo, redo, selection, coordinate, and attribute helpers; scrollToNodeViaDOMCoordinates accepts the new signature.
- Collaborative editors merge external extensions with embedded issue extension using memoization; dragDropEnabled is respected.
- CSS classes mobile-font and line-spacing-mobile-regular apply expected mobile sizes and spacing.
evalCommits.prompt: Add touch-device support to the editor so it behaves appropriately on mobile: disable hover/desktop-only UI (bubble menus, link previews, some image toolbar actions), prevent auto file input prompts, and keep essentials like zoom controls working. Add a menu item to insert or unset links that can optionally replace the current selection. Expand the editor ref API with focus, undo/redo, selection utilities, and a more flexible scroll method. Provide mobile typography and spacing variants via CSS classes. Wire these through the collaborative and non-collaborative editors, hooks, and extensions, ensuring configuration can be passed in (e.g., isTouchDevice, dragDropEnabled, editorProps, onEditorFocus) and stored where needed for downstream components.

Implement consistent project-scoped validations and id-based relation handling in Issue and DraftIssue serializers.

Scope:
- Files to modify:
  - apps/api/plane/api/serializers/issue.py
  - apps/api/plane/app/serializers/draft.py
  - apps/api/plane/app/serializers/issue.py

Requirements:
1) Parent issue validation
- In both API and App issue serializers (create/update paths), validate that a provided parent issue belongs to the same project (and workspace where applicable) as indicated by serializer context.
- For API serializer (apps/api/plane/api/serializers/issue.py), extend the existing workspace-scoped check to also restrict by project_id from context.
- For App serializers (apps/api/plane/app/serializers/issue.py and draft.py), validate parent existence within the same project via project_id in context. If invalid, raise a serializers.ValidationError with the message: "Parent is not valid issue_id please pass a valid issue_id".

2) State validation
- In App serializers (issue.py and draft.py), if a state is provided, verify it belongs to the same project via project_id in context. If invalid, raise: "State is not valid please pass a valid state_id".

3) Estimate point validation
- In all three serializers, when estimate_point is provided, validate that it belongs to the same project (and workspace for API serializer) using project_id (and workspace_id for API) from context. If invalid, raise: "Estimate point is not valid please pass a valid estimate_point_id".

4) Assignee validation via ProjectMember and roles
- In App serializers, when assignee_ids are provided, restrict them to active project members whose role meets the minimum member threshold. Use ProjectMember filtered by project_id from context, is_active=True, and role >= member threshold. In draft.py use ROLE.MEMBER.value from plane.app.permissions; in issue.py use the existing numeric threshold (>= 15) or align to the enum if already imported.
- Replace the incoming assignee_ids list with the filtered list of member_ids.

5) Label validation scoping
- In App serializers, when label_ids are provided (as objects or ids depending on current serializer input), ensure they belong to the same project (project_id in context). Normalize and replace the incoming list with a flat list of label ids that pass the project filter.

6) Description content validation
- Keep existing description, description_html, and description_binary validations using validate_json_content, validate_html_content, and validate_binary_data, respectively, within the validate method flow.

7) Bulk create/update with primitive ids
- Update bulk_create payloads for relation through models to use *_id primitives instead of passing model instances:
  - For DraftIssueAssignee: use assignee_id rather than assignee
  - For DraftIssueLabel: use label_id rather than label
  - For IssueLabel: use label_id rather than label in both create and update
- Ensure the iterable variables used in bulk_create comprehensions align with ids (e.g., for assignee_id in assignees, for label_id in labels).

Context keys expected in serializers

evalCommits.spec:
Implement server-side validation for description content across the API, centralize validation utilities, and refactor the Page binary update flow.

1) Create centralized content validation utilities
- Add a new module at apps/api/plane/utils/content_validator.py that exposes:
  - validate_binary_data(data) -> (bool, str|None): Accepts bytes or base64 string, enforces a maximum size of 10MB, ensures basic document validity (length >= 4), and flags suspicious text patterns (e.g., <html, <script, javascript:, data:, <iframe) in the first portion of decoded text. Returns (True, None) when valid, otherwise (False, reason).
  - validate_html_content(html_content: str) -> (bool, str|None): Enforces the same 10MB limit. Rejects malicious HTML patterns (e.g., script tags, javascript: URLs, data:text/html, dangerous event handlers containing JS), blocks dangerous link/style/meta/iframe usages, and performs a basic unmatched tag check ignoring recognized self-closing tags. Returns (True, None) or (False, reason).
  - validate_json_content(json_content: dict) -> (bool, str|None): Enforces the same 10MB size. Supports ProseMirror/Tiptap-style documents (type=doc with content array) and validates recursively, with a maximum recursion depth of 20. Flags suspicious script-like patterns in text and dangerous attribute values (href/src/action and event handlers like onclick/onload/onerror). Returns (True, None) or (False, reason).
- Include internal helpers to traverse JSON content arrays and nested structures with recursion depth guards.

2) Wire validation into serializers (API layer)
- apps/api/plane/api/serializers/issue.py: In the validate method, when present:
  - description: validate_json_content
  - description_html: validate_html_content
  - description_binary: validate_binary_data
  Raise serializers.ValidationError with field-specific messages when invalid.
- apps/api/plane/api/serializers/project.py: In the validate method, when present:
  - description: If it is a dict, validate with validate_json_content (plain text is allowed without JSON validation).
  - description_text: validate_json_content
  - description_html: If a dict, validate with validate_json_content; otherwise validate as an HTML string using validate_html_content (cast to string before checking).
  Return field-specific errors on invalid input.

3) Wire validation into app serializers
- apps/api/plane/app/serializers/draft.py (DraftIssueCreateSerializer): In validate, enforce:
  - description: validate_json_content
  - description_html: validate_html_content
  - description_binary: validate_binary_data
  Return field-specific errors.
- apps/api/plane/app/serializers/issue.py (IssueFlatSerializer): In validate, enforce the same trio of validators for description, description_html, and description_binary, with field-specific errors.
- apps/api/plane/app/serializers/project.py (ProjectSerializer): Add a validate method to perform the same validations as the API project serializer case (description dict JSON validation; description_text JSON; description_html JSON-or-HTML depending on type). Return field-specific errors.
- apps/api/plane/app/serializers/workspace.py (Workspace serializer handling description fields): Add a validate method and enforce:
  - description: validate_json_content
  - description_html: validate_html_content
  - description_binary: validate_binary_data
  Return field-specific errors.

4) Add a dedicated serializer for Page binary updates
- In apps/api/plane/app/serializers/page.py, define PageBinaryUpdateSerializer with fields:
  - description_binary: optional CharField (base64-encoded input)
  - description_html: optional CharField
  - description: optional JSONField
- Implement field-level validators:
  - description_binary: Decode base64 to bytes and validate using validate_binary_data. On success, return the decoded bytes for assignment. On failure, raise a field-specific error; for decoding issues, return a clear error (e.g., Failed to decode base64 data).
  - description_html: validate with validate_html_content; return field-specific error on invalid input.
  - description: validate with validate_json_content; return field-specific error on invalid input.
- Implement update(instance, validated_data) to assign any provided of description_binary, description_html, and description, save, and return the updated instance.
- Export PageBinaryUpdateSerializer from apps/api/plane/app/serializers/__init__.py so it can be imported by views.

5) Refactor the Page binary update endpoint to use the new serializer
- In apps/api/plane/app/views/page/base.py, for the endpoint handling partial updates to page descriptions (binary/HTML/JSON):
  - Replace manual base64 decoding and direct field assignment with PageBinaryUpdateSerializer(page, data=request.data, partial=True).
  - If valid, before updating, capture the existing instance state of description_html for change logging. After is_valid():
    - If description_html provided, queue page_transaction with new_value from request data and old_value as the previous HTML (existing_instance).
    - Save via serializer.save() to apply validated fields to the model.
    - Queue page_version with page_id of the updated page, the previous state (existing_instance), and user_id.
    - Return a success JSON response {"message": "Updated successfully"}.
  - If invalid, return serializer.errors with HTTP 400.

6) Imports/exports and error handling
- Ensure all modified serializers import validate_html_content, validate_json_content, and validate_binary_data from plane.utils.content_validator.
- Ensure views import PageBinaryUpdateSerializer from the serializers package.
- Keep existing business logic intact (assignee validations, identifier checks, etc.).
- Ensure validation is only applied when the respective fields are present in the payload.

Observable outcomes:
- Submitting malicious or oversized JSON/HTML/binary description payloads to Issue, Project, DraftIssue, Workspace, or Page endpoints results in 400 with field-specific error messages.
- Valid updates proceed; Page updates run page_transaction and page_version tasks as before.
- Page binary update uses the new serializer; no manual base64 decoding occurs in the view.

Implement improved emoji suggestion behavior across the editor emoji extension.

Scope:
- Packages: packages/editor
- Affected areas: Tiptap emoji extensionâ€™s suggestion matching and React suggestion list behavior.

Requirements:
1) Add and wire a custom suggestion matching helper
- Create a new helper at packages/editor/src/core/helpers/find-suggestion-match.ts that implements a custom findSuggestionMatch function for the emoji suggestion. The matcher must:
  - Correctly extract text across marks within the current paragraph using ProseMirrorâ€™s textBetween rather than relying on nodeBefore.text, so it works when the cursor is inside bold/italic/etc.
  - Respect suggestion Trigger config: char, allowSpaces, allowToIncludeChar, allowedPrefixes, startOfLine.
  - Compute the query and range from the current paragraph text up to the cursor and return null when conditions donâ€™t match.
- In packages/editor/src/core/extensions/emoji/emoji.ts, register this helper by passing findSuggestionMatch to the Suggestion plugin inside addProseMirrorPlugins alongside the existing suggestion options.

2) Propagate the current query to the suggestion list UI
- In packages/editor/src/core/extensions/emoji/suggestion.ts, ensure the current query is passed as a prop to the rendered EmojiList component on both onStart and onUpdate of the Suggestion render lifecycle.

3) Render control in the emoji list component
- In packages/editor/src/core/extensions/emoji/components/emojis-list.tsx, add a new required prop query: string to EmojiListProps and adjust component usage accordingly.
- Add an early return so the component does not render when query.length <= 0, preventing an empty suggestion dropdown.

Observable outcomes:
- Typing the emoji trigger (e.g. ":") inside formatted text reliably opens suggestions based on the contiguous query text preceding the cursor, independent of marks.
- Emoji suggestion dropdown only appears when at least one character has been entered after the trigger (query non-empty).
- The suggestion list receives and uses the current query during start and subsequent updates.

Do not modify any other editor behavior or unrelated extensions.
evalCommits.prompt: Improve the emoji suggestion feature in the editor so it detects trigger sequences inside formatted text and only shows the dropdown once at least one character of the query is present. Introduce a custom suggestion matcher that reads text across marks in the current paragraph to compute the match range and query. Wire this matcher into the emoji extensionâ€™s Suggestion plugin. Pass the live query through the suggestion lifecycle to the React emoji list component and prevent the list from rendering when the query is empty.

Implement consistent, field-level error validation and handling for project create/update across backend and frontend.

Backend (Django/DRF):
1) ProjectSerializer (apps/api/plane/app/serializers/project.py)
- Add field validators:
  - validate_name(name): Ensure the Project name is unique within the workspace in the serializer context. Exclude the current instance when updating. On conflict, raise a serializers.ValidationError with the field-level message list containing the code string "PROJECT_NAME_ALREADY_EXIST".
  - validate_identifier(identifier): Ensure the Project identifier is unique within the workspace. Exclude the current instance when updating. On conflict, raise a serializers.ValidationError with the field-level message list containing the code string "PROJECT_IDENTIFIER_ALREADY_EXIST".
- Create logic: On successful validation, create the Project with workspace_id from context and create a corresponding ProjectIdentifier record (name equals the project identifier) in the same workspace.
- Update logic: No special-casing for identifier/name conflicts in the view; rely on serializer field validators to block conflicts and surface field-level errors.

2) ProjectViewSet (apps/api/plane/app/views/project/base.py)
- Create endpoint: Remove try/except handling for IntegrityError and ValidationError; use serializer.is_valid() to return HTTP 400 with serializer.errors on failure. On success, save and then:
  - Create ProjectMember for the creator (role=20) and, if a distinct project_lead exists, ensure they are added as a ProjectMember (role=20) and have an IssueUserProperty.
  - Bulk create default State records for the newly created project.
  - Trigger model_activity as before.
  - Return the created project (ProjectListSerializer) with HTTP 201.
- Partial update endpoint: Enforce admin membership checks as before. If project is archived, return HTTP 400. Use serializer.is_valid() to return HTTP 400 with serializer.errors on failure. On success, save, ensure default Intake exists when intake_view is enabled, trigger model_activity, and return the updated project (ProjectListSerializer) with HTTP 200.
- Do not catch IntegrityError/ValidationError to convert to HTTP 409 or top-level "code" fields; rely on DRFâ€™s serializer.errors shape (field: [messages...]).

Frontend (Next.js/React):
3) Project create flow (apps/web/ce/components/projects/create/root.tsx)
- Adjust the error handler to parse the new backend error format: err.data is a field-to-array-of-errors mapping.
- If errorData.name includes "PROJECT_NAME_ALREADY_EXIST", show an error toast with the project_name_already_taken translation.
- If errorData.identifier includes "PROJECT_IDENTIFIER_ALREADY_EXIST", show an error toast with the project_identifier_already_taken translation.
- For all other fields (excluding name and identifier), iterate their errors. If an array, toast each string; if a string, toast it directly. Wrap in try/catch and show a generic something_went_wrong toast on unexpected parsing failures.

4) Project update flow (apps/web/core/components/project/form.tsx)
- Apply the same updated error parsing behavior as in the create flow: detect the specific code strings within the field arrays for name and identifier, show appropriate toasts, and iterate over any other field errors. Provide the same try/catch fallback toast.

Behavioral outcomes:
- API returns HTTP 400 with serializer.errors containing arrays under each field when name/identifier conflicts occur, with code strings inside the arrays (e.g., ["PROJECT_NAME_ALREADY_EXIST"]).
- The frontend surfaces specific, user-friendly toasts for name and identifier conflicts and displays other field errors robustly.
- Project creation and updates still perform member/state/intake setup and model activities as before, with no special 409 mapping for duplicates.
evalCommits.prompt: Unify backend validation and frontend error handling for project creation and updates. Add field-level validators to ensure project name and identifier are unique within a workspace and have human-readable codes in the field error arrays. Simplify the backend views to rely on serializer validation (returning 400 with field errors) and remove custom IntegrityError to 409 mapping. Update the web create and update flows to parse the new field-oriented error format, show specific toasts for name/identifier conflicts, iterate and display other field errors, and provide a safe fallback toast if parsing fails. Keep all existing project setup behaviors (membership, user properties, default states/intake, and activity logging) intact.

2) Update insert-handlers to use centralized helper
- File: packages/editor/src/core/extensions/table/plugins/insert-handlers/utils.ts
  - Remove the local isCellEmpty implementation.

4) Implement new delete key shortcut handler
- File: packages/editor/src/core/extensions/table/table/utilities/delete-key-shortcut.ts (new)
  - Export a keyboard shortcut command that:
    - Returns false unless the selection is a table cell selection and all selected cells are empty.
    - Determines the current table and uses TableMap to compute selection bounds (min/max row/col) and size.
    - If the selection spans all columns of the table, delete the selected rows (multiple) by positioning the cursor in the first selected row and invoking row deletion repeatedly.
    - If the selection spans all rows of the table, delete the selected columns (multiple) by positioning the cursor in the first selected column and invoking column deletion repeatedly.

Implement a consistent, portal-based full-screen rendering mechanism for key overlays to ensure they are never clipped or hidden by layout containers or the resizable sidebar.

Scope
- Web workspace project area only.
- Affects three features: Analytics Work Items modal, Gantt/timeline chart, and Issue Peek Overview.

What to implement
1) Add a global full-screen portal mount in the project layout
- In the workspace projects layout file (apps/web/app/(all)/[workspaceSlug]/(projects)/layout.tsx), add a single, empty div that will act as the portal root for full-screen overlays.
- The element must:
  - Have id="full-screen-portal".
  - Be absolutely positioned to cover the full content area (inset-0) and full width.
  - Sit inside the main content wrapper that is positioned relatively (so the portal positions correctly within the app area).

2) Migrate Analytics Work Items modal to portal-based full-screen
- In apps/web/core/components/analytics/work-items/modal/index.tsx:
  - Replace the dependency on @headlessui/react Dialog/Transition for the side panel variant with a plain React component that conditionally renders its content.
  - When the modal is opened in full-screen mode, render the modal content into the new portal root via ReactDOM.createPortal.
  - When not in full-screen mode, render the same content in place.
  - Ensure the outermost wrapper uses a z-index that is above the app shell (use a high stacking level, e.g., equivalent to z-[25]).
  - Toggle absolute vs. fixed positioning appropriately so the full-screen content occupies the entire portal area without unwanted scrolling or clipping.
  - Add a null-safe query for the portal element; if unavailable, fall back to inline rendering.
  - On close, ensure full-screen state is reset and then call the provided onClose handler.
  - Maintain previous behavior for non-full-screen and preserve header/content composition.

3) Migrate Gantt/timeline chart to portal-based full-screen
- In apps/web/core/components/gantt-chart/chart/root.tsx:
  - When fullScreenMode is enabled, render the chart container using ReactDOM.createPortal into the full-screen portal root.
  - Keep the same markup and behavior (header, controls, main content), but ensure its top-level container uses an elevated z-index (e.g., z-[25]) and full-area positioning within the portal.
  - When not in full-screen mode, render inline as before.
  - Add null checks for the portal container and provide inline fallback if it is not present.

4) Migrate Issue Peek Overview full-screen mode to portal-based rendering
- In apps/web/core/components/issues/peek-overview/view.tsx:
  - For peekMode === "full-screen" (and when not embedding), render the peek overview via ReactDOM.createPortal into the full-screen portal root.
  - Update positioning to absolute in full-screen mode and ensure elevated z-index (e.g., z-[25]).
  - For side-peek and modal modes (and for embedIssue cases), render inline as before.
  - Add null checks and fallback to inline rendering if the portal container cannot be found.

5) Consistency and accessibility
- Do not change feature logic, routing, or business behavior; only move full-screen rendering targets into the shared portal container when needed.
- Ensure that non-full-screen layouts behave exactly the same as before.
- Ensure dismiss/close/toggle controls work identically before and after the change.
- Preserve or improve scroll behavior in full-screen (no clipping or hidden content behind sidebars/headers).

Acceptance Criteria
- A div with id="full-screen-portal" exists inside the projects layout wrapper, positioned absolutely, covering the app content area.
- Analytics Work Items modal renders inline in regular mode; when toggled to full screen, it renders into the portal, covers the app, and is visibly above the sidebar and other chrome.
- Gantt chart renders inline in regular mode; when toggled to full screen, it renders into the portal, covers the app, and is visibly above other content without clipping.
- Issue Peek Overview renders inline in side-peek/modal; when switched to full-screen (non-embed), it renders into the portal, uses absolute positioning, and remains on top of the app.
- All three implementations guard against a missing portal container and fall back to inline rendering.
- Z-indexing is consistent and sufficiently high to avoid overlap issues (e.g., at least z-[25]).

Implement row/column insert handles and refactor table selection outline under packages/editor.

Scope:
1) Add a new ProseMirror plugin to render insert handles on tables and support click/drag interactions.
2) Refactor the table cell selection outline plugin into a new folder and update its import usage.
3) Wire the new insert plugin into the Table extension.
4) Update styling to visually support the new handles and selection outlines.

A. New insert-handlers plugin files
- Create packages/editor/src/core/extensions/table/plugins/insert-handlers/plugin.ts implementing a ProseMirror Plugin that:
  - Uses a PluginKey("table-insert").
  - On view init and on document changes, scans the editor view DOM for all TABLE elements and maps them to their corresponding ProseMirror nodes/positions.
  - For each table, appends two absolutely-positioned buttons to the table element:
    - A vertical column insert button on the right edge of the table (class: table-column-insert-button) with title/ariaLabel "Insert columns".
    - A horizontal row insert button along the bottom edge of the table (class: table-row-insert-button) with title/ariaLabel "Insert rows".
  - When editor.isEditable is false, removes any injected buttons and cleans up.
  - On destroy(), removes all buttons and clears internal maps.

Scope:

- Introduce a module-level, precompiled, case-insensitive regex pattern constant for URL detection.
- Detection must positively match all of the following patterns:
  - http:// and https:// URLs followed by non-whitespace.
  - URLs beginning with www. followed by a valid domain.
  - Domain-only references: one or more domain labels ending with a top-level domain (TLD) of length 2 to 6 (e.g., example.com, sub.domain.org, test-site.co.uk).
  - Valid IPv4 addresses only (each octet 0â€“255), with or without protocols.
- Detection must not match invalid or partial forms:
  - Lone or partial TLD words (e.g., "com org net").
  - Incomplete IPs (e.g., "192.168").
  - Invalid IPv4 addresses (e.g., "999.999.999.999").
  - Incomplete www. (e.g., "www.").
- Enforce input length limits to mitigate ReDoS and performance issues:
  - If the entire input string exceeds 1000 characters, immediately return False.
  - Otherwise, split on newline and process each line. For any line longer than 500 characters, truncate it to its first 500 characters prior to testing.
  - If any processed line matches the detection pattern, return True; else return False.
- Keep detection case-insensitive.

2) Validate existing URL utilities behavior
- is_valid_url must:
  - Return True for well-formed URLs that include both a scheme and netloc (e.g., http, https, ftp URLs).
  - Return False for strings without a scheme, malformed schemes, or empty strings.
  - Return False for non-string inputs (e.g., None, lists, dicts).
  - Return False for special schemes without netloc (e.g., mailto:, file:).
- normalize_url_path must:
  - Replace multiple consecutive slashes in the path portion of a URL with single slashes.
  - Preserve scheme, netloc (including optional port), query string, and fragment.
  - Handle root paths and empty paths correctly.

- Tests for contains_url:
  - Positive cases across http, https, www-prefixed, domain-only, subdomain patterns, and valid IPv4 addresses.
  - Case-insensitive matching.
  - Negative cases for plain text, partial TLDs, incomplete IPs, invalid IPs, incomplete www., and empty strings.
  - Length behavior: under 1000 chars with URL returns True; exactly 1000 with URL returns True; over 1000 returns False (even if URL present). Include multiline scenarios under the total limit and verify detection works on lines, including a long line truncated to detection length.
- Tests for is_valid_url:
  - Valid URLs: http, https, subdomains with paths/query, localhost with port, ftp.
  - Invalid: no scheme, just scheme, empty, malformed schemes, non-string inputs, and special schemes without netloc (mailto, file).

  - Query and fragment preserved.
  - Root path and empty path behavior.
  - Different schemes (http, ftp) and URLs with ports handled correctly.

- Do not change public function names or signatures: contains_url, is_valid_url, get_url_components, normalize_url_path remain as-is.

Implement a table UI and behavior refactor in the editor that includes a selection outline, default column widths, and drag-handle/side-menu adjustments, with tables rendering as full-width blocks.

Requirements:
1) Table selection outline plugin
- Create a ProseMirror plugin that decorates selected table cells with classnames indicating which edges need borders.
- Only active when the editor is editable and the current selection is a CellSelection.
- For each selected cell, compute adjacent selected cells using the TableMap and add classes for missing borders: selectedCell-border-top/left/bottom/right.
- Return a DecorationSet from the plugin and expose it via props.decorations.
- Integrate this plugin into the table cell extension via addProseMirrorPlugins so that table cells receive the correct classes during multi-cell selection.
- Place the plugin under packages/editor/src/core/extensions/table/plugins/table-selection-outline/ with plugin.ts and utils.ts, where utils exposes getCellBorderClasses and uses an internal getAdjacentCellPositions.

2) Default column width
- Introduce a DEFAULT_COLUMN_WIDTH export (150) in packages/editor/src/core/extensions/table/table/index.ts.
- Use DEFAULT_COLUMN_WIDTH as the default colwidth attribute value for TableCell and TableHeader nodes (set default to [DEFAULT_COLUMN_WIDTH]).
- Update table creation logic to accept and apply the default column width value: adjust createTable to accept a props object instead of positional args and pass columnWidth when constructing cells.
- Update insertTable command to remove the columnWidth argument from the signature, and internally pass DEFAULT_COLUMN_WIDTH to createTable.
- Update all callsites that passed columnWidth (e.g., editor-commands) to call insertTable without columnWidth.

3) Drag handle and side menu behavior for tables
- Change selectors and hit testing to target the table element instead of the .table-wrapper when positioning drag handles and side menu.
- Specifically update the drag handle plugin and side-menu logic so that table hit detection and positioning use the table element (e.g., node.matches("table") and elem.closest("table")).
- Ensure drag-handle offsets for tables (rect adjustments) align with the new selector.

4) Full-width table block styling and content width behavior
- Modify table-view NodeView root wrapper class to include an editor-full-width-block class so the table spans the full content width, while standard blocks retain centered width.
- In variables.css, scope ProseMirrorâ€™s max-width/margins only to direct children not marked with .editor-full-width-block. Children with .editor-full-width-block must have max-width: 100%, left padding equal to the side gutter ((100% - editor-content-width)/2), and right padding equal to var(--wide-content-margin).

5) Table CSS updates
- Move table styles under .table-wrapper scoping using nested selectors to keep table, td, th rules intact but allow full-width behavior.
- Adjust borders to use border-300 for td/th and add visual behavior for ProseMirror-selectednode on table wrapper (background overlay).
- Add CSS for selected cell outline using the classes set by the selection outline plugin. The pseudo-element ::after should draw 2px borders only on the necessary sides.
- Adjust column-resize-handle position to align with the outer border and account for 2px height and negative offsets.

6) Editor commands
- Update insertTableCommand in packages/editor/src/core/helpers/editor-commands.ts to no longer pass columnWidth to insertTable.
- Preserve behavior that prevents inserting tables inside existing tables and that replaces selected ranges when applicable.

7) Ensure no regressions:
- Table creation should produce cells with default colwidth set to DEFAULT_COLUMN_WIDTH in both header and body cells.
- Drag handle and side menu should align correctly against table edges with updated offsets.
- Multi-cell selection should show clear outer borders without double borders between adjacent selected cells.

Files to change:
- packages/editor/src/core/extensions/table/table/table.ts: Update Table node options, insertTable command signature and implementation to use DEFAULT_COLUMN_WIDTH and new createTable signature.
- packages/editor/src/core/extensions/table/table/utilities/create-table.ts: Refactor to accept a props object including columnWidth.
- packages/editor/src/core/extensions/table/table/table-view.tsx: Add editor-full-width-block to the wrapper element.
- packages/editor/src/core/extensions/table/table/index.ts: Export DEFAULT_COLUMN_WIDTH constant.
- packages/editor/src/core/extensions/table/table-cell.ts: Register TableCellSelectionOutlinePlugin via addProseMirrorPlugins and set colwidth default to [DEFAULT_COLUMN_WIDTH].
- packages/editor/src/core/extensions/table/table-header.ts: Set colwidth default to [DEFAULT_COLUMN_WIDTH].
- packages/editor/src/core/extensions/table/plugins/table-selection-outline/plugin.ts: Implement the selection outline plugin as described.
- packages/editor/src/core/extensions/table/plugins/table-selection-outline/utils.ts: Implement getCellBorderClasses and adjacency logic.
- packages/editor/src/core/plugins/drag-handle.ts: Target table element instead of .table-wrapper in selectors and hit-testing logic.
- packages/editor/src/core/extensions/side-menu.ts: Target table element instead of .table-wrapper for side menu positioning and tweak rect offsets.
- packages/editor/src/core/helpers/editor-commands.ts: Remove columnWidth from insertTable calls.
- packages/editor/src/styles/table.css: Update table styling, borders, selected cell outline, column resize handle, and control styles to reflect the new structure.
- packages/editor/src/styles/drag-drop.css: Ensure .table-wrapper is excluded from default node selection styling and inherits correct grab overlay behavior.
- packages/editor/src/styles/variables.css: Implement editor-full-width-block behavior for ProseMirror children.

Goal: Correct the date properties rendering and interaction for issue properties and sub-issues so that a merged date range control is shown only when both dates are present and enabled, and otherwise individual date pickers are shown. Apply overdue highlighting and enforce logical min/max constraints.

Scope: Update the following components:
1) web/core/components/issues/issue-detail-widgets/sub-issues/issues-list/properties.tsx
2) web/core/components/issues/issue-layouts/properties/all-properties.tsx

Required behaviors and structure:
A. Conditional rendering of date controls
- Determine a boolean isDateRangeEnabled that is true only when:
  - issue.start_date is set AND issue.target_date is set AND
  - displayProperties.start_date and displayProperties.due_date are both enabled.
- Wrap a merged date range UI in WithDisplayPropertiesHOC with displayPropertyKey=["start_date", "due_date"], and set shouldRenderProperty to return isDateRangeEnabled. This merged UI uses a DateRangeDropdown with mergeDates enabled and isClearable true.
- Add two additional WithDisplayPropertiesHOC blocks for start_date and due_date, each with shouldRenderProperty returning !isDateRangeEnabled. Each block renders a single DateDropdown for that date.

B. Overdue highlighting for due/target date
- Use useProjectState().getStateById(issue.state_id) to get the state group and compute shouldHighlightIssueDueDate(issue.target_date, stateDetails?.group).
- If shouldHighlightIssueDueDate returns true, apply a red text class to the due date button for both the merged DateRangeDropdown and the single due DateDropdown. Do not highlight when state is completed or cancelled.

C. Date constraints and values
- Compute minDate and maxDate using getDate(issue.start_date) and getDate(issue.target_date) respectively; do not mutate Date objects directly.
- In the single start DateDropdown, set maxDate to the computed target date; in the single due DateDropdown, set minDate to the computed start date.
- The merged DateRangeDropdownâ€™s value should be { from: getDate(issue.start_date) or undefined, to: getDate(issue.target_date) or undefined } and onSelect should update both dates via the existing handlers.

D. Icons, i18n placeholders, and UI classes
- Use CalendarClock for the start date and CalendarCheck2 for the due date icons on the single DateDropdowns.
- Use the i18n strings for placeholders: t("common.order_by.start_date") and t("common.order_by.due_date"). Ensure useTranslation is initialized in the component.
- Set DateDropdown buttonVariant to border-with-text when a date is present, otherwise border-without-text. For merged DateRangeDropdown use an appropriate border-with/out-text variant determined by presence of any date.
- Add clearIconClassName to DateRangeDropdown (light text color for the clear icon) and optionsClassName to DateDropdown (set z-index classes to avoid layering issues: e.g., "z-10" in all-properties, "z-30" in sub-issues).
- Keep existing tooltip behavior: showTooltip should be enabled; for DateRangeDropdown provide a "Date Range" heading (or localized equivalent where used) and renderPlaceholder=false when merged.

E. Event handling and disabled state
- Preserve existing handlers for updating dates (e.g., handleStartDate, handleTargetDate, handleEventPropagation) and call them from the new components appropriately.
- Respect the read-only/disabled state already used in each component: in sub-issues pass the inverted disabled boolean as in existing usage; in all-properties pass isReadOnly to the DateDropdown/DateRangeDropdown.
- Maintain renderByDefault behavior for mobile where present (all-properties should render by default on mobile for dropdowns).

F. Imports
- Add necessary imports: useMemo (React), CalendarCheck2/CalendarClock (lucide-react), useTranslation (@plane/i18n), DateDropdown from @/components/dropdowns, shouldHighlightIssueDueDate (from @plane/utils or the projectâ€™s helper barrel), and useProjectState from @/hooks/store/use-project-state. Ensure existing date utilities (getDate, renderFormattedPayloadDate) remain where needed.

Acceptance criteria:
- When both start_date and due_date exist and are enabled in display properties, a single merged DateRangeDropdown is shown; clearing it clears both dates.
- When either date is missing or one of the display properties is disabled, the UI shows two separate DateDropdowns (one for start, one for due) if their respective display property is enabled.
- The due date control (merged and single) visually highlights with red text if due is overdue and the state group is not completed/cancelled.
- Selecting start date cannot go beyond current due date; selecting due date cannot precede current start date.
- Placeholders are localized, icons appear as specified, tooltips render correctly, and z-index layering issues are resolved.
- No runtime errors from missing imports; the components compile and render as expected.

Enforce logical min/max constraints between start and due dates, use appropriate icons and localized placeholders, maintain tooltip behavior, and apply a red text highlight to the due date when overdue for non-completed/cancelled states.
